intro: Calystegia purpurata subsp. purpurata, commonly known as the purple bindweed, is a flowering plant in the family Convolvulaceae. It is characterized by its trailing growth habit and distinctive purple to pink flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous small seeds. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Due to its aggressive growth, it can become invasive in some regions.
